title: Energy Sources
description: Learn more about America's energy sources: fossil, nuclear, renewables and electricity.
cleaned_text: Primary energy sources take many forms, including [nuclear energy](/nuclear), [fossil energy](/fossil) [hydropower](/eere/water/water). These primary sources are converted to [electricity](/electric-power), a secondary energy source, which flows through power lines and other transmission infrastructure to your home and business. Learn more about America's energy sources: [fossil](/fossil), [nuclear](/nuclear), [renewables](/clean-energy) and [electricity](/electric-power). Learn more about energy from solar, wind, water, geothermal, biomass and nuclear. [VIEW MORE](/clean-energy) The Energy Department is developing new technologies that will store renewable energy for use when the wind isn't blowing and the sun isn't shining. [VIEW MORE](/energy-storage) Fuel cells use the energy from hydrogen in a highly efficient way -- with only water and heat as byproducts.
